There are two **solutions** for me if this issue is not fixed. **One** is to return back to use` fit_generator` instead and feed my data from my own `generator,` as numpy array, and this one is much  slower than `model.fit`. The **second** is to keep use model.fit but instead of passing class_weigth, I should build custom loss function where I do the weighted loss.

If anyone just justify the condition in line 531 to make it work for both `tensor` and `numpy` array, it will help a lot.
